__comment__: Thailand data processing files will be transformed using this python code for INV and SOS because the raw data files have same structures.

It does not seem like it is worth it to split into two config files just because of this ONE difference. But we did it because if we combine both steps in one config file, we will have to use a function to load another file (because transform module only allows us to load ONE file as a base file in the beginning.
We want to prevent people forgetting to update the name of the new raw file to load every month. So we split these steps into two.
If we pass None for 'sheet_name' parameter in reading Excel files, pandas will read ALL the sheets.
The equivalent of None in JSON file is null. That's why we are providing null below to read all the sheets in the file.

functions_to_apply.__function_comment__: Excel file has empty columns. We need to drop them first
By the time we run this function, there should be only 13 columns total remaining in the raw data frame.
Delete row with value '*' from 'Baht' column.
Drop empty rows in 'Baht' column.
Add PROCESSED_DATE that holds the current date value.
Add new column name based of possible columns names for date column

Add HARMONIZED_REGION as a new column with 'Asia Pacific' as value.

Multiply HARMONIZED_GROSS_SPEND column by 1000 from raw gross spend column.

Create RAW_PRODUCT_NAME column from existing product name column.
